intro: Dubautia paleata, commonly known as the pale bush. It is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands, specifically found on the island of Maui. This species belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its compact growth habit and showy yellow flowers. Dubautia paleata typically grows in rocky or coastal habitats, thriving in full sun and well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species, highlighting the importance of conservation efforts in preserving its natural environment.
